intro: Senecio leptocarpus, commonly known as the slender-fruit senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while the flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Senecio leptocarpus is often used in rock gardens due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
